data.meta_desc: Saw this post: Winner of 2015 Women's World Cup gets $2 million from FIFA Losing a quarterfinal in 2018 Men's World Cup $16 million from FIFA Men's team gets 8x more prize money for LOSING their quarterfinal this year than a women's team gets for winning the whole thing. #RUSCRO #ENGvsSWE Maybe that's because the 2014 World Cup generated $4.8 billion in revenue while the 2011 Women's World Cup only generated $73 million. That means the men made 66 times more money than the women did. FIFA isn't sexist. it just understands simple economics unlike you. and I was curious about the actual numbers and ratio: Man (WC 2014) Woman (WC 2015) Total prize money 348'000'000 15'000'000 Revenu 4'800'000'000 73'000'000 Ratio revPrize 13.79 4.87 Prize money with Ratio swap 986'301'369.86 5'292'500 Even if there are other factors here is a breakdown: Men World cup 2014 had 348M total prize money and generated 4.8 billion revenue which is nearly 14 times the cost of the total prize money. Women world cup 2015 had 15M total prize money and generated 73 million revenue which is nearly 5 times the cost of the total prize money. With a swap of the ratio RevenuePrize money between men and women Men prize money would have been 9863 Millions (nearly 3 times more) and women prize money would have been 5.3 million (nearly 3 times less) and for the long post Memes.

That means the men made 66 times more money than the women did.
